definitions.definition: (usually in the plural) Anything that is sold by itself, especially an article of clothing.
To divide (a thing) into separate parts.
definitions.example: Separate the articles from the headings.

definitions.definition: To disunite from a group or mass; to disconnect.
To cause (things or people) to be separate.
definitions.example: If the kids get too noisy, separate them for a few minutes.

definitions.definition: To divide itself into separate pieces or substances.
definitions.example: The sauce will separate if you don't keep stirring.

definitions.definition: To set apart; to select from among others, as for a special use or service.
Apart from (the rest); not connected to or attached to (anything else).
definitions.example: This chair can be disassembled into five separate pieces.
I try to keep my personal life separate from work.
